node.title: 9-Year-Old Boy Who Was Injured at Astroworld Festival Dies
node.alt: A vigil outside the Astroworld music festival site last week.
node.description: Ezra Blount, who had been in a coma, became the 10th, and youngest, person to die from injuries sustained there.
node.content: ["A 9-year-old boy on Sunday became the 10th, and youngest, person to die from injuries sustained at the Astroworld festival.", "The boy, Ezra Blount, had been in a medically induced coma from injuries his family believes he sustained after being trampled at the Nov. 5 festival, an outdoor concert in Houston headlined by the rapper Travis Scott that was attended by 50,000 and took a tragic turn after a crowd surge occurred near the stage during his performance. Authorities are still trying to determine the cause.", "The death was announced on Sunday night by the mayor of Houston, Sylvester Turner.", "\u201cOur city tonight prays for his mom, dad, grandparents, other family members and classmates at this time,\u201d Mr. Turner wrote on Twitter. \u201cThey will need all of our support in the months and years to come. May God give them strength.\u201d", "Ezra, a fan of Mr. Scott, spent the concert on the shoulders of his father, Treston Blount. But the boy became one of more than 300 people who sustained injuries. Some had heart attacks.", "Dozens, several of them minors, like Ezra, were in critical condition afterward.", "His father detailed the tragic evening on a GoFundMe page. After passing out from lack of oxygen, Mr. Blount regained consciousness with no idea where his son was. By the time they were reunited, his son had swelling in the brain as well as \u201ctrauma in nearly all organs,\u201d Mr. Blount wrote.", "As Ezra spent the rest of his days in a hospital, his father documented his son\u2019s condition on the GoFundMe page, where thousands of people made donations.", "\u201cThank you everyone for what you have done for my family,\u201d Mr. Blount wrote on Nov. 11. \u201cPlease keep hope alive and never stop praying.\u201d", "The Blount family previously filed a lawsuit against Mr. Scott; Live Nation Entertainment, which promoted the concert; and others. Dozens more have filed lawsuits, and the Houston Police Department is conducting a criminal investigation into the festival.", "\u201cThis should not have been the outcome of taking their son to a concert, what should have been a joyful celebration,\u201d Ben Crump, the lawyer who represents the Blount family, wrote in a statement. \u201cEzra\u2019s death is absolutely heartbreaking.\u201d"]
